A reservoir is filled with a liquid of density 2000kgm<sup>-3</sup>. Calculate the depth at which the pressure in the liquid will equal to 9100Nm<sup>-2</sup>[g = 10ms<sup>-2</sup>]
A solid weight 45N and 15N respectively in air and water. Determine the relative density of the solid
explanation:
R.d = \(\frac{\text{weight in air}}{\text{apparent loss of weight in water}} = \frac{45}{45 - 15}\)

= \(\frac{45}{30} = 1.50\)

question: A spiral spring of natural length 30.0cm and force constant of 20Nm<sup>-1</sup>is compressed to 20.0cm. Calculate the energy stored in the spring
Which of the following statements correctly defines quantitatively the work done by a force? the product of the force and the distance moved
explanation:
The quantity of work done (or energy converted) by a force, when the force moves, depends on two obvious factors:
- the distance moved (in the direction along which the force acts) and
- the magnitude (strength) of the force
options: parallel to the line of action of the force from a reference point
perpendicular to the line of action of the force from a reference point
on a line through the reference point
